item.title: By: Stabbity
item.dc:creator: Stabbity
item.content:encoded:
Holy crap, service vs control submission makes so much sense! Seriously, I’ve spent years wondering what the hell people who wanted “training” were talking about. I’m very much service oriented in my relationships but not interested in ritual, so I just never understood why someone would need extensive training to serve me a cup of tea, for example. But if what someone wants is a micromanagey scene where they repeat every step until they get it perfect and get ‘punished’ for every (possibly imaginary) mis-step, that actually makes sense to me.

Because I’m so service oriented, I thought it was about the service being provided, not about being controlled. The whole training idea just makes so much more sense when I understand that the ‘service’ is kind of the peg the scene hangs on, but not the point of the scene, if that makes sense.

But I want what I want, dammit!

That reminds me of this brilliant comment I read on a blog post about being submissive and dealing with douchebag doms:

Sooo often with the guys who do not understand that the dynamics of being a dom include actually getting your partner off as well.
I like being submissive because it turns me on, not because it turns you on..so do something with that!

I’m dominant because it turns me on, not because it turns submissive men on, why shouldn’t you be the same?
